page.title: 06Inch Church-Castle Kennedy
page.content: The Church was rebuilt in 1897 after a fire. A local story says the minister banned singing in church but the local people did sing. Lightning struck and the church caught fire. The people saw this as a judgement. The church has 73 pews and can seat 582 people though there are only 300 members.About 100 attend regularly. The organ was rebuilt in 1980 and in 1984 a new oil boiler and P.A. system were installed The church has 575 gravestones,the oldest being 1894. It has 16 arched windows, 3 in stained glass. The Sunday school has 50 members and the Women's Guild has 30.In 1982 Inch linked with St. Andrews in Stranraer. On the 1st. July 1985 Inch will unite with Lochryan.The minister is Reverend T.O'Leary. The religion is Church of Scotland.
